授業目的: This course analyzes the reality of the Japanese legal system from a socio-legal perspective. The analysis focuses especially on criminal justice and human rights issues in Japanese society from the perspective of international human rights law.
到達目標: Students will develop basic knowledge of the Japanese legal system and become familiar with some of the human rights issues including concrete examples of legislations and judicial cases in Japan.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】総合日本学習科目（法制度）（CIEC）/Japanese Legal System　１（国際学部）
授業方法: Face-to-face format. The class structure of this course will be a short lecture on the topic, class discussion, and participation and summation on the issues.  Students will be expected to have read the assigned materials before the class and prepared to respond to the questions raised in the class. Additionally, students will be expected to be ready for briefing articles and cases in the course materials and will be prepared to discuss those articles and cases.

第2回: Overview of Japanese Law: Japanese Constitution and Other Major Legal Codes (Roppo)
第3回: Japanese Judicial System & Professional Lawyer Training
第4回: Criminal Procedures (1): Features of Criminal Investigation
第5回: Criminal Procedures (2): Prosecution and Trial Process
第6回: Criminal Procedures (3): Human Rights Issues in Criminal Justice, CAT
第8回: International Human Rights Law and Japanese Legal System: Overview
第9回: International Human Rights in Japan(1): Two Covenants (ICCPR & ICESCR) and UPR
第10回: International Human Rights in Japan(2): CERD
第11回: International Human Rights in Japan(3): CEDAW
第12回: International Human Rights in Japan(4): CRC
第13回: International Human Rights in Japan(5): CRPD
トピック.授業外学習2:
1 Preparation for Class
The course is mostly discussion centered and, therefore, students are expected to come to class after having read the assigned readings and to have prepared fully to participate in class discussions. Proper classroom behavior is expected at all times. Again, preclass reading of the assigned reading materials is essential and crucial for understanding the issues and your effective class performance.
2 Class Participation
Please note that class participation is very important in this course. Student participation creates positive and effective thinking with a good learning environment. During each class, the instructor will be evaluating the quality of the student’s participation and responses.
3 Attendance
Class attendance is a primary obligation of each student whose right to continued enrollment in the course and to take the examination is conditioned upon a record of attendance satisfactory to the school.
4. I will arrange a field trip to the Osaka or Kobe District Court to see the criminal trials by using two-class hours. Details will be announced in class.
